bibl.title: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Superintendent, St. Vincent's Hospital, January 22, 1916

div1.p: Stimpson arranges for Carter to be reimbursed for payment made to St. Vincent's Hospital.

div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Superintendent, St. Vincent's Hospital, January 22, 1916
div1.opener:
January 22, 1916.
The Superintendent,
St. Vincent's Hospital,
Birmingham, Ala.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Dr. H. R. Carter, Assistant Surgeon General,
Public Health Service, was treated in St. Vincent's
Hospital from August 28 to September 8, 1915, and
the cost of said treatment was paid the hospital by
Dr. Carter. It is desired to reimburse Dr. Carter
for expense of this treatment. In order to do this,
it will be necessary to pay St. Vincent's Hospital
for said treatment and have the hospital reimburse
Dr. Carter. You are therefore requested to render
a voucher, on the inclosed form, for treatment furn-
ished said officer while under treatment in St. Vuncent's
Hospital. The voucher should be itemized.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, (Signed) W. G. Stimpson
Assistant Surgeon General. Incl: 1.
